Mu Cai

Currently, I am a third-year Ph.D. student in the Department of Computer Sciences at the University of Wisconsin- Madison, supervised by Prof. Yong Jae Lee. I got my bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering and Automation at Xi’an Jiaotong University in 2020. My research interest lies in the intersection of deep learning and computer vision. I am especially interested in 3D scene understanding and self-supervised learning.

news

Aug 26, 2022 Paper “Out-of-distribution Detection via Frequency-regularized Generative Models” is accepted to WACV 2023 (Spotlight).
Jul 6, 2022 Paper “Masked Discrimination for Self-Supervised Learning on Point Clouds” is accepted to ECCV 2022.
May 10, 2022 Start summer research internship on 3D scene understanding at QCraft .
Jan 21, 2022 Paper “VOS: Learning What You Don’t Know by Virtual Outlier Synthesis” is accepted to ICLR 2022.
Jul 30, 2021 Paper “Frequency Domain Image Translation: More Photo-realistic, Better Identity-preserving” is accepted to ICCV 2021.
Jul 1, 2020 Paper “A Game-Theoretic Policy-Aware Interaction Strategy with Validation on Real Traffic Data” is accepted to IROS2020
